page.title: 12 The Iron House.
page.content: Property situated on the old Arley Rd which probably was used as a pack horse route to Bewdley.Before the Staffs & Worcs canal was cut,produce of Stour valley iron-works were transported in this way.During the 3rd quarter of the 18th centuary the property was probably an inn.Judging by the cellars.Hearsay has it that it was the last pub to Arley.Judging the remaining parts of the structure it was a sandstone building.The weather affected the sandstone so iron plates were attached to the outer walls.The house was owned by a family,their name was Griffiths, from 1825-1850.In 1915 there was a fi- re & the iron plates prevented the flames from being extinguished & the near portions of the house were destroyed.It was rebuilt in 1916.
